What of the mysterious wizard Malichtharn? Can they satisfy the requests of the shade of Landor? The quest is perilous but the potential rewards are great. Can the characters successfully conclude the quest?

49965.name: Arden
49965.description:
From the Publisher's website:

A gamemaster's aid to Chivalry and Sorcery: A complete kingdom.

One of the nations in the Archaeron Campaign of the designers of Chivalry and Sorcery, Arden contains 24 maps showing the basic geography of the land, with a clear plastic hex grid to gauge distances, plus a book giving historical and environmental details, including population, politics, resources etc. Designed to facilitate role playing scenarios on many levels.

49966.name: Paths of the Wise
rpg: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
49966.description:
The richness of Middle-earth lies in the depth of its histories, the detail of its languages, and the breadth of its cultures. Paths of the Wise: The Guide to Magicians & Loremasters brings the abundance of the land’s magic and lore to your The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game chronicle. It provides everything you need to portray mighty spellcasters and characters of awesome learning and great wisdom. It is a treasure trove of new rules, background material, and game advice for player and Narrator alike.

(From the back cover)

49967.name: Liberati Sourcebook
49967.description:
From the back cover:
Harvesting a meager living from the surface of a rough primal world, the Liberati are a proud and tough people, revels and nomads that do not fit the highly structured society of the Trench. Stuck between uncaring megacorporations and a fascist invader bent on conquest, it is literally a do-or-die situation for those brave souls on the front line of the new conflict racking the Heavy Gear universe! This manual contains background information and resources on the underground freedom fighters and nomad miners on Caprice.
This sourcebook includes:

A complete history of the Liberati.
Full overview of Liberati culture and lifestyle.
Resistance operations and resources.
Sample Liberati-oriented campaign set-ups.
New character archetypes, equipment and vehicles.

49968.name: In Cerca di Fortuna
49968.description:
Appeared in June 1987, it is the first gamebook written in Italy together with "Il Presidente del Consiglio sei tu".
The setting is pure fantasy, influenced by RPG; the geography is built on Genoa and the Appennins north of it, in the valleys between Busalla and Voltaggio.
The game system for character generation and tests will later be used for a series of easy introductory RPGs, and later called "Qui comincia l'avventura".
In 1988 Enrico Colombini programmed a software version of this gamebook, released by Applesoft as a Huperstack for MacIntosh personal computers.

49969.name: Land of the Rising Sun
rpgissuearticle: How I Designed Land of the Rising Sun
Land of the Rising Sun Filler
Reviews - Land of the Rising Sun
49969.description:
From the back cover:

A role playing game in the age of the Samurai. Land of the Rising Sun offers a detailed look at this exciting era using the game systems made popular by Chivalry & Sorcery.

Hailed by experts for its authenticity, the game includes all rules for characters, magic, encounters, world generation, and even the customs and buildings of Japan.

box set includes

the softcover book (152 pages) and 5 cardstock pages of charts

49970.name: Colonial Expeditionary Force Sourcebook
49970.description:
From the back cover:
The Colonial Expeditionary Force is the interstellar fighting arm of the New Earth Commonwealth, and one of the main antagonists of the Heavy Gear universe. Equipped with advanced technology and vat-grown gene-engineered warriors, they are intent on subjugating the entire interstellar network of human-colonized worlds for the greater glory (and profit) of the Commonwealth! This sourcebook details the history, structure, procedures and equipment of this deadly foe.
This sourcebook includes:

A complete history of the Colonial Expeditionary Force.
Background details on strategies, uniforms, medals and procedures.
New characters, equipment and vehicles.

49971.name: L'Esodo su Terminus
49971.description:
L'Esodo su Terminus

The Exodus to Terminus

First volume of the Galactic Foundation Games, a collection of Italian gamebooks set in the Foundation trilogy by Isaac Asimov. The famous Sci-fi writer is credited as the author, but actually they have been written by Leonardo Felician who is credited as "testi a cura di" ("text editor").

From the back Cover

Would you kill Hari Seldon with your own hands? Would you break Salvor Hadin career? How would you organize the transport of 100,000 people on a planet on the edge of the galaxy?

49973.name: Bushido (1st Edition)
rpgissuearticle: We're Going On A Bear Hunt
49973.description:
This was the very first version of the Bushido system that went on to be published by Phoenix and F.G.U.

In Bushido, the Players take roles as members of various professions and wander through Nippon. The overall campaign is organized by a Game Master whose imagination is only the starting point for many hours of intriguing and entertaining enjoyment.

The Heroes of Nippon is the player's guide and contains the rules for creating characters, combat, and magic. It features an Attribute system which allows a character to be tailored to a player's specifications.

The Land of Nippon is the referee's guide and contains rules of Encounters, Battles, and other things necessary lo the campaign.

Bushido uses pencil and paper, six and twenty-sided dice, a Game Master, and as many players as will brave the perils of Nippon.

49974.name: L'Archibugio di Fermoy
49974.description:
"L'Archibugio di Fermoy" ("Fermoy's Arquebuse") is the first gamebook using the Iperlibri system and also the first one in the "La Leggenda degli Erranti" ("The Wanderers' Legend") cycle.

From the Back Cover

During a New Year's Eve on the small "Island of Musicians", a little man in the back of an ox deliver to Eel O'Reel, captain of the company, a magical gun, daring him to shoot a burst against him.

49975.name: Bushido (2nd Edition)
rpgissuearticle: We're Going On A Bear Hunt
49975.description:
This was the second version of the game that went on to be published by F.G.U. under the same title.

It is largely similar to the first version published by Tyr, but includes a complete upgrade of the text including all errata.

49977.name: Ships of Terra Nova
49977.description:
From the back cover:
Terra Nova has a relatively small space fleet for a sovereign world in command of its own fate. Nevertheless, in recent times, the personnel and vehicles of this fleet have been called upon to embark on one of the most pivotal, important tasks in the strife-rich history of the human race. Spaceship Compendium I: Terra Nova takes a look at these people, their ships and some of the infrastructure that supports them.
This sourcebook includes:

A detailed look at one of Terra Nova's Gateships, the UMFGS Laban Emuros.
Spacecraft for both military and civilian operations.
Terranovan launch facilities, including an Aurora-class landship mobile launch facility.
Detailed deckplans and maps of several ships and facilities.
Sample campaign seeds.
New equipment and NPCs.

49978.name: Mitico!
49978.description: A series of very short gamebooks, first appearing as single items on game magazines (Kaos, E Giochi) and then collected together as an anthology. Humor is a fundamental part of them, and "Oripetea" is even composed in verses as a parody of the Odissey. "L'isola di Anastrofe" is a classical adventure where the reader has to find an artifact on the island where he shipwrecked, besides the way to go back home. "Il labirinto di Creta" is a maze described from the point of view of the person walking in it: very little but very tricky - the labyrinth is almost identical to the one featured in the "In cerca di fortuna" gamebook.

49979.name: Spartaco
49979.description: "Spartaco - La rivolta dei gladiatori" ("Spartacus - The gladiators' revolt") is a historically accurate gamebook set in Italy in 73 b.C.: the reader leads a group of revolting gladiators against the troops of Rome. Duiring the game, an account of surviving and joining people is kept, so that at the end a score can be used to compèare results between different games. A column running along the pages explain all the historical setting of the game.

49980.name: Facchetti celo, Giubertoni manca!
49980.description: "Facchetti celo, Giubertoni manca!" ("Facchetti I have, Giubertoni I miss") is a historically accurate gamebook set in 1973. The main character is a kid who has to complete his collection of footbal players stickers before sunset. All the TV shows, ice creams, toys and whatever quoted in the text are accurately taken from everyday life in Italy at that time. The title of the story is actually "Facchetti celo", while "Giuibertoni manca" is the section that collects all the rules of games played by kids to gamble with the double stickers of their collection.

49981.name: Villains' Lorebook
49981.description:
From the back cover:

Evil takes many forms in the lands of Faerun. This book brings all of them out of the darkness and into the light.

These are the characters who have tested the mettle of the foremost heroes of the Forgotten Realms campaign world. They spread chaos and death wherever they venture, ruining what ever they touch. And they are coming to your campaign.

Inside this companion volume to Heroes' Lorebook you'll find complete game statistics and descriptions for a host of dastardly rogues, most of whom have never been described in a game accessory before.

49982.name: Ships of the C.E.F.
49982.description:
From the back cover:
The interstellar invasions performed by the Colonial Expeditionary Forces could never have been possible without their massive fleets. These are now stationed everywhere in the Earth and Caprice systems, reading to strike again at the former colony worlds. Spaceship Compendium II: CEF/Caprice takes a look at the invaders' ships and the infrastructure that supports them in the Loki star system. This sourcebook contains:

A detailed look at the main CEF Gateship type, the massively armored Tortoise-class.
Spacecraft for both military and civilian operations.
Caprician launch facilities.
Detailed deckplans and maps of several ships and facilities.
Sample campaign seeds.
New equipment and NPCs.

49983.name: Babylon 5: A Call to Arms (Second Edition) – Powers and Principalities
49983.description:
From the back cover:

Powers & Principalities is an essential companion to Babylon 5: A Call to Arms, 2nd edition. Packed full of new rules, scenarios, campaigns, and exclusive background material, this supplement will transform your games and give you more tactical flexibility with your fleets.

Inside you will find:

Fleet Command: A Wealth of unique rules for fleets, stressing the indivicuality of each race. Start playing with Abbai mines, Shadow screams, and many more!

New Ships: All new variants of your favourite ships, tweaked for specific tactical duties.

The Gaim Intelligence: The complete Gaim fleet list, allowing you to bring the Hive Mind to the tabletop.

Space Stations: Build your own space station, for any fleet, with an easy to use construction system.

Unique Admirals: Powerful heroes who can influence an entire battle.

New Background Material: Never published before source material, uncovering the secrets of the Earth-Minbari War and the Narn fleet.

49986.name: White Dwarf (Issue 6 - Apr 1978)
49986.description:
"The Science Fiction and Fantasy Games Magazine"

Contents:

D & D Article
"Combat and Armour Class" (Roger Musson)

D & D Monsters
"The Fiend Factory" (Don Turnbull)

"Figures Review"
Archive Miniatures reviewed (John Norris)

News

D & D Scenario
"A Place in the Wilderness" (Lew Pulsipher)

Open Box
SF & F games reviewed

Letters

Traveller
Review of the new SF role-playing game (Don Turnbull)

Comic Strip
"Kalgar" written and drawn by (David Lloyd)

D & D Article
"Treasure Chest" (Duncan Campbell, Brian Asbury, Martin Easterbrook)

Classifieds and Help!

49987.name: The Combatant's Guide to Slaughtering Foes
49987.description:
From the back of the book:

Whether you profess to be the greatest warlord in the Wurld, or need to gird yourself for battle with one of these incredible fighters, this book is for you! What you hold in your hands is a codex that will guide your quest for glory like a brilliant beacon amid a coastal storm. This tome will assist your rise above the petty rabble of thieves, quacks, and bookworms otherwise known as everyone you've ever met. This thoroughly researched and finely detailed reference work includes everything you ever wanted to know about the masters of the art of hack.

49988.name: Il Gobbo Maledetto (1st Edition)
49988.description:
User summary:

This is a solo-adventure gamebook, illustrated with about 40 original photographs taken during the Second World War.

It is july 23rd, 1941 and you have just graduated from a Royal Italian Air Force flight training school. You are assigned to a torpedo bomber squadron equipped with the Siai Marchetti S.79, one of the most famous Italian airplane of WWII, nicknamed "Il Gobbo Maledetto" ("The Damned Hunchback") by the Italian press because the rear-firing machine gun gave its fuselage a distinctive appearance.

Your plane takes off from the Pantelleria island for your first mission. You have an experienced crew at your orders. You have find an English fleet headed for Malta, try to sink an enemy ship with your only torpedo and fly back to your airfield. Many things can happen along your way...

Nearly one hundred original photographs illustrate all the main events of the game: from fighters' attack to dropping the torpedo, from emergency sea landings to the arrival of an air-sea rescue flying boat.

The introduction is by Martino Aichner, who earned the Golden Medal for Military Gallantry for sinking the British ship HMS Bedouin in 1942 with his S.79 torpedo bomber.

The game, through "windows" scattered all over the book, helps to discover the airplanes involved and several aspect of aerial warfare in the Mediterranian in those years.

49989.name: Il Gobbo Maledetto (2nd Edition)
49989.description:
User summary:

Second edition for this gamebook, whose interesting feature is the use of original WW2 pictures to illustrate the different stages of the story. In this edition they are increased to about one hundred.

Time is set at July 23rd, 1941. You have just graduated from a Royal Italian Air Force flight training school. You are assigned to a torpedo bomber squadron equipped with the Siai Marchetti S.79, one of the most famous Italian airplane of WWII, nicknamed "Il Gobbo Maledetto" ("The Damned Hunchback") by the Italian press because the rear-firing machine gun gave its fuselage a distinctive appearance.

Your plane takes off from the Pantelleria island for your first mission. You have an experienced crew at your orders. You have find an English fleet headed for Malta, try to sink an enemy ship with your only torpedo and fly back to your airfield. Many things can happen along your way...

Nearly one hundred original photographs illustrate all the main events of the game: from fighters' attack to dropping the torpedo, from emergency sea landings to the arrival of an air-sea rescue flying boat.

The introduction is by Martino Aichner, who earned the Golden Medal for Military Gallantry for sinking the British ship HMS Bedouin in 1942 with his S.79 torpedo bomber.

The game, through "windows" scattered all over the book, helps to discover the airplane involved and the historical background.

49990.name: The Griftmaster's Guide to Life's Wildest Dreams
49990.description:
From the back of the book:

Whether you profess to be the greatest grifter in the world, or need to gird yourself for battle with one of these sneaky backstabbers, this book is for you! What you hold in your hands is the codex that will guide your quests for fantastic riches that sparkle like a brilliant beacon amidst a coastal storm. This tome will assist your rise above the elitist quacks, thugs, and bookworms otherwise known as everyone else you've ever met (outside of your guild, of course). This thoroughly researched and finely detailed reference work includes everything you ever wanted to know about the masters of stealth and cunning.

49991.name: Life on Utopia
49991.description:
From the back cover:
Utopia, once one of the jewels of the Concordat interstellar colonization program, now lies in ruins, its carefully constructed eco-system ravaged by generations of unending strife. Despite the hardship it forced on itself, this harsh planet harbors dynamic societies that not only lived through the turmoil of the post-colonial period but managed to survive beyond. As the forces of the imperialist New Earth Commonwealth prepare their take-over of the human worlds, however, Utopia finds itself a divided planet, stuck between allegiance to their old master and a bright future offered by its fellow colonials. The Waste World lies on the blade's edge, and anyone's actions can tip the balance...
Life on Utopia is the second sourcebook in a line detailing the human colony worlds of Dream Pod 9's exciting Heavy Gear science-fiction universe. Within these covers you will find:

A complete history of the Utopian world.
An extensive examination of Utopia's characteristics, from its geology and hydrography to each region's particular characteristics.
A listing of all settlements, with location, population, political system and special characteristics described in depth.
Dozens of important personalities for the players to meet and interact with.
An in-depth examination of the cultures, habits and lifestyles found throughout Utopian societies.
New archetypes, equipment, vehicles, drones and campaign ideas.

49992.name: White Dwarf (Issue 7 - Jun 1978)
rpgissuearticle: Feudal Economics in Chivalry and Sorcery
Thoughts on the Proliferation of Magic Items in D&D.
49992.description:
"The Science Fiction and Fantasy Games Magazine"

Contents:

Chivalry and Sorcery
Feudal Economics - Starting off in life (Ed Simbalist)

News

D & D Monsters
"The Fiend Factory" (Don Turnbull)

Letters

D & D Article
"Treasure Chest" (John T Sapienza, Jr and Brian Asbury)

Molten Magic
Photos of miniature figures by Minot's Miniature Armoury, Oracle Miniatures, Wargames Publications, Archive Miniatures, Ral Partha, Miniature Figurines and Greenwood & Ball

Open Box
SF & F games reviewed

Comic Strip
"Kalgar" written and drawn by (David Lloyd)

D & D Scenario
"Lair of the Demon Queen" (Don Turnbull)

D & D Article
"Thoughts on the Proliferation of Magic Items in D & D" (E. Gary Gygax)

Questionnaire

Classifieds and Help!

49993.name: Life on Atlantis
49993.description:
From the back cover:
The water world of Atlantis has resisted the CEF invaders for more than twenty years, neither side having the resources to break the stalemate. Now new forces are coming into play that threaten the balance as other colonies reach out across the Gateweb to twist the Atlantean conflict to their own ends. Utopia stands with Earth, developing new submersibles and weapons of war, while Terra Nova - who threw back the invaders decades ago - move to support the native resistance. Who will prevail, and can Atlantis afford the cost of either failure or victory?
Atlantis is a deadly waterworld where even the slightest mistake can spell instant death. This sourcebook includes:

A complete history of Atlantis' colonization and its war against the CEF.
Information on the Atlan Corporate Hegemony.
Details of Atlantean Gaianism.
Information on the CEF Fifth Fleet, the Antartis resistance and the Waverider sub-culture.
Full write-ups and maps for 16 Atlantean city-states and Tels.
Sample campaign setups.
New character archetypes.
Rules for deep-water operations.

49994.name: The Spellslinger's Guide to Wurld Domination
rpgissuearticle: Under the Hood - The Spellslinger's Guide to Wurld Domination
49994.description:
From the back of the book:

Whether you profess to be the greatest spellslinger, or need to gird yourself for battle with one of these power-wielders, this book is for you! What you hold in your hands is the codex that will guide your quest for ultimate power like a brilliant beacon amidst a coastal storm. This tome will assist your rise above the petty rabble of thieves, quacks, and thugs otherwise known as everyone else you've ever met. This thoroughly researched and finely detailed reference work includes everything you ever wanted to know about the masters of arcane craft.

49995.name: Life on Eden
49995.description:
From the back cover:
Eden: a planet where neither needs nor desires seemed to go unsatisfied, without conflict, in blissful, cooperative anarchy. Unfortunately, the Fates had a different future in mind: following an out-of-control experiment over a hundred fifty years ago, Eden was devastated by a series of massive cometary impacts. Now, the survivors of the Apocalypse are struggling atop the ashes of an ecologically damaged world while the anarchy of their past has given way to warring kingdoms and privateer consortiums. Conflicts over now scarce resources have created numerous battlefields; doom cults abound; and a strained confederacy of kingdoms is nearing the brink of a global civil war as politicians and princes, seeking to protect their political assets, grasp toward hope for a future.
Life on Eden is the first sourcebook to detail the farthest of humanity's colony worlds, Eden. Within these covers, you will find:

An extensive examination of Eden's solar system and planetary characteristics.
A complete history of the Edenite colony.
Source material on the Gan Eden Confederacy and the Privateer Consortiums.
Extensive information on the cultures and habits found throughout Edenite society.
Tips and tools for creating roleplaying campaigns on Eden.
Game statistics for Edenite character archtypes, Fauna, Flora and important NPCs.

49996.name: The Zealot's Guide to Wurld Conversion
49996.description:
From the back of the book:

Whether you profess to be the greatest preacher in the Wurld, or need to gird yourself for battle with such a dangerous conduit of divine wrath and retribution, this book is for you! What you hold in your hands is the codex that will guide your quests for saving the souls of millions like a brilliant beacon amidst a coastal storm. This tome will assist your rise above the rabble of thieves, thugs, and bookworms otherwise known as everyone else you've ever met. This thoroughly researched and finely detailed reference work includes everything you ever wanted to know about the masters of divine providence.

49997.name: The Compass of Terrestrial Directions, Vol. II: The West
49997.description:
From the publisher's website:

Secrets of the Great Western Ocean Revealed

This second directional supplement presents Exalted’s major seafaring nations—Wavecrest, Coral, Skullstone and the Neck—and reintroduces the gender-role-redefining Tya and everybody’s favorite Demon-Blooded pirates, the Lintha Family to Second Edition. In addition, the mystery of the sunken First Age metropolis of Luthe is explored.

A setting book for Exalted® Second Edition

* The second of five Terrestrial Direction books devoted to fleshing out the bare bones of Creation presented in the Exalted core book, this one devoted to the West
* Mass combat stats for the forces of the Silver Prince, the Lintha Family and other Western powers, as well as dominion stats for the Mandate of Heaven
* Traits for the West’s native gods and beasts

49998.name: The Compass of Terrestrial Directions, Vol. III: The East
49998.description:
From the publisher's website:

A Guide to Creation’s Far East

Beyond the Scavenger Lands lies much more than a rough frontier of rural backwaters and petty kingdoms. The Far East is full of nations that rival its supposedly more “civilized” neighbors in terms of size and sophistication, from the warring states of Linowan and Halta, to the floating land of Metagalapa and even grim Sijan, ancient city of the honored dead. Still, the region’s reputation as a land of untamed wilds and rough barbarians is not without merit, as the broad Eastern forests are home to a myriad of human, once human and completely inhuman tribes. The wealth of the East lies within these forests, waiting for those brave enough to take it.

A setting book for Exalted®, Second Edition, featuring:

* The third of five Terrestrial Direction books devoted to fleshing out the bare bones of Creation presented in the Exalted core book, this one devoted to the East
* Mass combat stats for the forces of Halta, Linowan and other Eastern powers, as well as dominion stats for the Mandate of Heaven
* Traits for the East’s native gods and beasts

49999.name: Technical Manual (2nd Edition)
49999.description:
From the back cover:

Nothing drives technological advancement quite like warfare, and Terra Nova has seen more than its fair share. Almost every aspect of technology has greatly advanced, from new armor-grade materials and deadly Heavy Gears, to computers that learn by themselves and extensive genetic manipulations. The Technical Manual 2nd Edition examines the technology of the world of Heavy Gear and provides full background and development information, technical illustrations and complete rules for using, repairing and modifying technology in Heavy Gear games.

This book includes the complete Heavy Gear Vehicle Construction System (VCS).

50000.name: Lace & Steel
50000.description:
From the "side" of the box:

"Welcome to a world of grace and beauty, of breathtaking romance and dashing adventure. A fantasy world of swashbuckling, of dire magics and dazzling balls, where the royal court provides as much challenge to a player as the battlefields or the faerie forests.

LACE & STEEL takes role playing games out of their rut of dour violence and aggression to offer a whole universe of other possibilities. Characters establish personalities, friendships and hatreds, fears and loves to make interpersonal relations a vital part of play. Rules for romance, repartee conflict, flirtation and fashion give players the unique opportunity to venture into courtly role play-a playing style where the ladies can truly come into their own. For the military minded, there are rules for massed battles and sea fights, deadly magic and duels.


LACE & STEEL is quite unique - ancient magics mingle wth rapiers and muskets to make life doubly dangerous. It is a world where many races thrive - Humans, Half-Horses (centaurs), Satyrs and Harpies, while at the edges of civilization sinister faeries, trolls and ogres lurk in haunted forests.

The games systems are clean and simple - easy to learn but entirely flexible. The games most unique assets are its card based conflict systems. Hand-to-hand combat, sorcery and repartee are all simulated by special card games - games that are quick to learn but that offer players the opportunity to fail or triumph according to their own efforts, rather than on the mere hazard of a dice.

This box contains three booklets of game rules, an adventure booklet and two decks of special cards."
